website_summaries.verdict: High-quality replacement handle that's made to tightly fit big and heavy hammer heads.
pros: Handle that consists of hickory wood that will give you an excellent level of performance with amazing looks over time
Grain of the wood looks especially good
Really nice price point for a hammer handle of this quality
Handle measures 16 inches in length, so it works best for bigger hammer heads
cons: May take a bit of sanding and some other adjustments to make the handle fit properly

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Well let me start out by saying the finish wasn't great, but if I hated it that bad I would refinish it. It took a lot of modification to fit in the hammer head. So, if you think this will be a quick fix it won't be unless you have a belt or palm sander. I am a young kid with limited funds so I had to use a rasp. It comes with a wedge which leaves the handle nicely secured.
customer_reviews.author: Kristy J. Klingele

customer_reviews.title: Good handle.
customer_reviews.text: I had a very old hammer. The replacement required a lot of filing to get the right fit. But the end product is a solid, functional hammer.
customer_reviews.author: Scott M.

customer_reviews.title: It's a superior replacement hammer handle
customer_reviews.text: It's a superior replacement hammer handle. The wood grain is gorgeous, but it's one star degraded because the finish is awful. Once the finish is removed, the handle sanded down (I cut in custom grip areas), custom fit for the hammer head, and refinished, it's a solid product that'll last for decades.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Good handle, especially for the cost.
customer_reviews.text: Finish is okay...but it's a hammer handle. I don't care that much. I wish it came with more than one wedge, but I just re-used one from the handle I was replacing. Honestly, the hardest part is getting the old handle out of the hammer head. After that, it's pretty easy to tap (well...bash) the new one into place and then trim the top and wedge it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Vier

customer_reviews.title: Hard wood!
customer_reviews.text: Used to restore an old ball pein hammer. I refinish the wood to my liking and it turned out great.
customer_reviews.author: Sore Shins

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality look forward to a long long use of ...
customer_reviews.text: You have to know what you're doing to make a hammer handle fit properly but if you can do it this handle appears to be of the same quality of the one that I replaced and it lasted about 40 years. Excellent quality look forward to a long long use of my old old hammer
customer_reviews.author: White Horse

customer_reviews.title: Good shape, easily applied to the hammer head.
customer_reviews.text: Great quality, that you would expect from an original equipment supplier.
customer_reviews.author: Frederick E Zerlaut

customer_reviews.title: it's a handle
customer_reviews.text: Seems well made and solid. However, much smaller and lighter than expected. Was too small for my uses and is now one of those extra things you have hanging around forever. Maybe I'll send it back.
customer_reviews.author: kreepykent

customer_reviews.title: Looks great! just didnt fit the ball peen hammer I ...
customer_reviews.text: Looks great! just didnt fit the ball peen hammer I wanted it to. It will fit another one that is starting to break. Will replace it when the time comes
customer_reviews.author: PrimeShopper

customer_reviews.title: Hammer handle.
customer_reviews.text: Good solid handle for a drywall hammer. I had to modify it a little, however, it works just like I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Informed Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy wood. Good construction. Finish is a little rough on the hand but nothing some sanding won't fix
customer_reviews.author: JzeroSH

customer_reviews.title: Well made, and hickory will be strong as heck.
customer_reviews.text: Just right for an old Miller Falls head I found in the attic.
customer_reviews.author: Another consumer

customer_reviews.title: Great handle!
customer_reviews.text: Great replacement handle, complete with wedge. I would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: James H. Cason

customer_reviews.title: Nice wood handle and a decent price
customer_reviews.text: An economic alternative to a new hammer, I had to trim it on my grinder and belt sander to fit properly. Nice wood handle and a decent price.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Sauber

customer_reviews.title: Good handle, the only place I could find that ...
customer_reviews.text: Good handle, the only place I could find that sold handles. Thought I would have to buy a new hammer.
customer_reviews.author: ron schwarz

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: While driving the new handle in my hammer it snapped off just below the slot for the wedge.
customer_reviews.author: Kimsguy

customer_reviews.title: Snapped
customer_reviews.text: Installed ok (took some fitting), however the third strike on a piece of wood to test it, and it snapped at the top of the handle.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Denton

customer_reviews.title: not at all like original.
customer_reviews.text: took an hour to shave and make it fit.not at all like original.
customer_reviews.author: MAC

product_meta.title: Seymour 407-19 16-Inch Ball Peen Hammer Handle
product_meta.description: Size:16" Length| Style:Model 407-19 for 24 to 28 oz. hammersSeymour link handles 407-19 16-inch ball peen hammer handle
feature_bullets: Shock-absorbing American Hickory with Clear lacquer and Fire finish
